verses.verse: ([A Psalm] of Solomon.) Give<WH5414> the king<WH4428> Thy judgments,<WH4941> O God,<WH430> And Thy righteousness<WH6666> to the king's son.<WH1121>
May he judge<WH1777> Thy people<WH5971> with righteousness,<WH6664> And Thine afflicted<WH6041> with justice.<WH4941>
Let the mountains<WH2022> bring<WH5375> peace<WH7965> to the people,<WH5971> And the hills<WH1389> in righteousness.<WH6666>
May he vindicate<WH8199> the afflicted<WH6041> of the people,<WH5971> Save<WH3467> the children<WH1121> of the needy,<WH34> And crush<WH1792> the oppressor.<WH6231>
Let them fear<WH3372> Thee while<WH5973> the sun<WH8121> [endures], And as long<WH6440> as the moon,<WH3394> throughout all<WH1755> generations.<WH1755>
May he come<WH3381> down<WH3381> like rain<WH4306> upon the mown<WH1488> grass, Like showers<WH7241> that water<WH2222> the earth.<WH776>
In his days<WH3117> may the righteous<WH6662> flourish,<WH6524> And abundance<WH7230> of peace<WH7965> till<WH5704> the moon<WH3394> is no<WH1097> more.<WH1097>
May he also rule<WH7287> from sea<WH3220> to sea,<WH3220> And from the River<WH5104> to the ends<WH657> of the earth.<WH776>
Let the nomads<WH9478> of the desert<WH9478> bow<WH3766> before<WH6440> him; And his enemies<WH340> lick<WH3897> the dust.<WH6083>
Let the kings<WH4428> of Tarshish<WH8659> and of the islands<WH339> bring<WH7725> presents;<WH7725> The kings<WH4428> of Sheba<WH7614> and Seba<WH5434> offer<WH7126> gifts.<WH814>
And let all<WH3605> kings<WH4428> bow<WH7812> down<WH7812> before him, All<WH3605> nations<WH1471> serve<WH5647> him.
For he will deliver<WH5337> the needy<WH34> when he cries<WH7768> for help,<WH7768> The afflicted<WH6041> also, and him who has<WH369> no<WH369> helper.<WH5826>
He will have<WH2347> compassion<WH2347> on the poor<WH1800> and needy,<WH34> And the lives<WH5315> of the needy<WH34> he will save.<WH3467>
He will rescue<WH1350> their life<WH5315> from oppression<WH8496> and violence;<WH2555> And their blood<WH1818> will be precious<WH3365> in his sight;<WH5869>

So may he live;<WH2421> and may the gold<WH2091> of Sheba<WH7614> be given<WH5414> to him; And let them pray<WH6419> for him continually;<WH8548> Let them bless<WH1288> him all<WH3605> day<WH3117> long.

May there be abundance<WH6451> of grain<WH1250> in the earth<WH776> on top<WH7218> of the mountains;<WH2022> Its fruit<WH6529> will wave<WH7493> like [the cedars of] Lebanon;<WH3844> And may those from the city<WH5892> flourish<WH6692> like vegetation<WH6212> of the earth.<WH776>

May his name<WH8034> endure<WH1961> forever;<WH5769> May his name<WH8034> increase<WH5125> as long<WH6440> as the sun<WH8121> [shines]; And let [men] bless<WH1288> themselves by him; Let all<WH3605> nations<WH1471> call<WH833> him blessed.<WH833>
Blessed<WH1288> be the Lord<WH3068> God,<WH430> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> Who alone<WH905> works<WH6213> wonders.<WH6381>
And blessed<WH1288> be His glorious<WH9202> name<WH8034> forever;<WH5769> And may the whole<WH3605> earth<WH776> be filled<WH4390> with His glory.<WH9202> Amen,<WH543> and Amen.<WH543>
The prayers<WH8605> of David<WH1732> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> are ended.<WH3615>
